character: Luke Skywalker is an INFP. He is laidback and conflict-averse until his values are challenged. He makes decisions based on what he feels is right or wrong, and he always stays true to his values. This ultimately prevents Luke Skywalker from being tempted by the Dark Side. INFPs are known for their idealism and Luke Skywalker is the perfect example of this. He always tries to see the best in people, even when they’ve done something wrong. This can be seen when he forgives Darth Vader in Return of the Jedi. INFPs are also known for being independent and individualistic, just like Luke Skywalker. He’s always going off on his own to try and help others, even when it goes against what the rest of the group wants.

character: Luna Lovegood is an INFP. She has the most vivid imagination of all of the Harry Potter characters. She lives in her head a lot rather than in the real world. Luna also has a kind heart and sees the best in people. INFPs are known for their compassionate and individualistic nature, just like Luna Lovegood. Luna is also a bit of an outsider. She doesn’t necessarily fit in with the other students at Hogwarts. INFPs are often seen as different from others because of their unique perspective but they never compromise on their beliefs or their identity for the sake of fitting it. Luna Lovegood is an excellent example of a fictional INFP character.

character: Frodo Baggins is an INFP. INFPs are selfless individuals who can see the bigger picture and put others before themselves, just like Frodo. He was self-sacrificing in his dangerous journey from the Shire to Mount Doom in Mordor. Frodo cared deeply about destroying the One Ring and ridding the world of Sauron’s evil, even though it meant putting himself and his friends in great danger. Frodo also showed individualism as he was the only one who could destroy the One Ring. Even when he was tempted by the ring, Frodo never wavered in his decision to destroy it. This took a lot of willpower that many other Lord of the Rings characters did not have. Frodo is also compassionate, idealistic, and independent, just like an INFP. He has a strong sense of morality and is always true to his values.
